intro: Calysericos tabularis, commonly known as the flat-leaf calysericos, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique leaf structure, which is flat and broad, adapted to its particular ecological niche. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in inflorescences that are tightly packed. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Calysericos tabularis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
